bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
My custom dataset is too large to fit into RAM with --cache-images option enabled. So, I decided to split it into multiple parts and run training procedure sequentially with each part. On the second pass, I found that mAP and F1 dropped significantly (mAP ~ 0.9 -> 0.008). When I started to figure out what was going on, I discovered that the labels are not cached again and I need to delete them like this: <denchmark-code>!rm -f data/my_custom_dataset/training/labels.npy !rm -f data/my_custom_dataset/validation/labels.npy </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Create a small custom dataset and split it into multiple parts, then train model sequentially with each part. <denchmark-code>$ python train.py ... --data data/my_custom_dataset/part1.data --epochs 75 ... $ python train.py ... --data data/my_custom_dataset/part2.data --epochs 150 --weights weights/best.pt ... </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Invalidate labels cache for subsequent runs. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
Google Colab free tier.
